usefulItems: parchment paper, springform pan (9 in.), baking sheet, oven, refrigerator
title: Pumpkin Cheesecake

ingredients.content: 4 oz unsalted butter, plus extra to grease
1 egg white, from a large egg

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 250°F. Grease a springform pan (9 in.) and line bottom and sides with parchment. Place on a baking sheet and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/212°F/speed 1<b>.<b>
Add ginger snaps and sugar and mix <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>.<b> Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>.
Spread crumb mixture into base and up sides of prepared springform pan. Press firmly into a compact layer with a spoon or hands. Place in refrigerator while making the filling. Clean mixing bowl.

Place cream cheese, sour cream, sugar, egg, egg white and vanilla into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Pour ⅔ cream cheese mixture over crust.
Add pumpkin purée, brown sugar and pumpkin spice mix into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.

Drop spoonfuls of pumpkin mixture onto plain mixture and run a knife through batter in a swirling motion to create a marbled effect. Bake 10 minutes (250°F). Reduce temperature to 225°F and bake a further 1 hour 50 minutes (225°F).
Turn off oven, leave door ajar and allow cheesecake to cool 30 minutes before placing in refrigerator to chill completely (approx. 4 hr.). Serve chilled.
